content.question: Which of the following is a true statement about the behavior of WordClass objects?

choices.label: Every time a WordClass object is created, the maxWord variable is referenced.
Every time a WordClass object is created, the value of the maxWord variable changes.
No two WordClass objects can have their word length equal to the length of maxWord.
The value of the maxWord variable cannot be changed once it has been initialized.

content.answer: Every time a WordClass object is created, the maxWord variable is referenced.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
